CONJUGATES: more admirable | most admirable | admirably (adv) | admirableness (n)
ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English, via Old French, from Latin admirabilis, from admirari ('to wonder at, marvel at'), formed by ad- ('to') + mirari ('to wonder').

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Deserving of respect, high esteem, or praise; inspiring admiration.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 值得钦佩的；令人敬佩的；可敬的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The team showed an admirable effort despite the loss.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 尽管输了比赛，这支队伍仍表现出了令人敬佩的努力。
